website_summaries.verdict: An excellent tool in the proper application, but some of its competitors are better options overall.
pros: Venting system protects motor from grit
Paddle switch is a nice feature
cons: Runs hot and will sometimes smoke before failure

customer_reviews.title: No protection from overheating
customer_reviews.text: The grinder's initial build quality and workmanship seemed good considering the price. However, as someone new to using angle grinders, I was unaware of the risk of damaging the motor via overheating. Within 24 hours of opening the box, I had damaged the device by overworking it while grinding concrete. Because this is a common problem with angle grinders, imho Makita should have taken AT LEAST ONE of the following steps: (a) discussed the risk of overheating in the owner's manual, (b) provided a mechanism to issue a warning and/or shutdown the tool when internal temperature is too hot, and/or (c) covered this kind of damage in their warranty. Unfortunately none of these things is the case.
customer_reviews.author: PseudoRandomGuy

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with this Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Wow what can I say! This makes my 20th Makita small tool purchase dating back to 1980 when Rockwell circular saws went out of business. I have never known ANY problems with my Makita tools, like so many claim to have. When they wear out I send them back and have them rebuilt. I have been doing construction since 1975 and built over 400 homes renovated over 200 more and have operated some really junky tools but none of them are Makita's. This little grinder is a breeze to operate and the case is TOP SHELF! Four grinding disc's and a diamond wheel cutter and an extra wheel guard for under 80 bucks. WOW just WOW!
customer_reviews.author: sixfooter

customer_reviews.title: Is this a joke?
customer_reviews.text: A fine example of Chinese quality. It looks like my old Makita, but after the first few minutes it started making a bad noise and the motor slowed noticeably. After less than five minutes it was apparent that the grinder head was trying to seize. They should give these to prisoners for April fools and watch them try to cut their way out, for fun. This grinder was a bad joke! I guess I'll try Milwakee or DeWalt.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Wells

customer_reviews.title: Runs hot
customer_reviews.text: Great grinder with great accessories. Bought mine to grind down the frame of my truck with a wire wheel. Got about 10% of the way (20mins of constant grinding) until I noticed the grinder getting very HOT but i kept going. Eventually I started to see smoke come from the vent area on the grinder. Let it cool down for an hour and it still seemed to work. Not sure if this is normal or not.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Good Value- Good for Occasional Use.
customer_reviews.text: Yes, there are better angle drivers. But do you need a better angle driver? In my case where it will be needed occasionally, the answer is no. It's solid and easy to handle with the reversible grip. The paddle lock out switch makes for easy starting. The aluminum case is better than a bag and nice for storage. Along with 5 grinding wheels and 1 diamond wheel makes this the one of the best valued package. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Evans

customer_reviews.title: VERY VERY difficult to change attachments - Extremely poor shaft lock function and placement
customer_reviews.text: VERY VERY difficult to change attachments - Extremely poor shaft lock function and placement. Also cannot use several common attachments with the guard installed and which is also awkward to adjust and/or remove. Not user friendly AT ALL. I hate it. I've had many positive experience with Makita products over several decades but now am VERY disappointed in the quality of their design staff's competence.
customer_reviews.author: lonewolfmtn

customer_reviews.title: Better value than Milwaukee and Dewalt
customer_reviews.text: I would give the tool 5 stars for value of the purchase for having a hard case with a foam insert that holds the discs with an extra guard. Better value than Milwaukee and Dewalt. This angle grinder is lighter then the comparable models and I do love the deadman switch. I gave 4 stars because the way the angle grinder was packaged with no bubble wrap in a big box. The case kept the tool safe during delivery but the case ended up with a few scratches and dings. Overall happy.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Works very well for light/medium use.
customer_reviews.text: Very handy tool. Gets the job done with no fuss. It will heat up with continued use, so it's not for using all day. I needed to remove about 30 fence posts; the kind you drive in with a sledge hammer. I did about 10 a day and it cut through them beautifully, using several blades. I had a pack of 10 blades. I probably still have 7. I then used it to cut angle iron, and square bar; pretty heavy stuff. It worked great. Take your time and ease it thru the metal. Any grinder throws a lot of red hot particles, so it can be a fire hazard. Prepare accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: David A.

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't get in better than Makita
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Makita grinder (someone stole the first one) I've purchased and just like the first one it is a versatile use item. I'm using it now to cut metal lawn edging using a thin Makita metal cutting blade. The grinder is well built, easy to operate, easy to change discs and as a bonus comes with a heavy duty storage case. I highly recommend this grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Harley R.

customer_reviews.title: Nothing i dont like about this tool and case
customer_reviews.text: Bought this tool 4 years ago. My second one after first was stolen. I use it hard all year long. Eventually burned up the worm gear inside the head and was able to locate a part on line and repair it myself for about $12. This grinder blows away my other dewalt. Im a big fan of the paddle switch but also really like the case that comes with this. Keeps all my attachments and wheels all in one spot all the time. For a corded grinder i dont think you can go wrong here.

customer_reviews.title: Been using these for many years, they hold up well and are of good quality.

They simply are the best for the money - yes, you can find cheaper ones, bigger ones, other ones, etc.., but this thing will work for 90% of people 90% of the time. Very good quality (even after all these years). Highly recommended, the latest one we purchased has been used regularly now for almost 5 years with no issues.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use grinder and powerful for its size

These grinders will last you forever and are very powerful. It was very easy to manoeuvre and cut straight through the hood. Attached are some pictures of the project. Will use this grinder for several other projects in and around the house!
customer_reviews.author: Martijn

customer_reviews.title: POWERFUL GREAT BUY! Makita 9557PBX1 4-1/2" Paddle Switch Cut-Off/Angle Grinder
customer_reviews.text: 10 AMP motor, nice case, good selection of grinding wheels included. Much more powerful than cheaper 3-6 amp angle grinders. Our first use was to power a grinding diamond wheel for tile thin set removal. No problem, drove through heavy, dusty loading well. I would buy again without hesitation. I have always had good service from Makita power tools and looks like this grinder will be a good one as well. If you are facing thin set removal, see my reviews on other components to do that job. (Makita A-96198 Double Row Anti-Vibration Diamond Cup Wheel, 4-1/2"; Dust Collecting Wheel Guard, 4-1/2 In by Makita)

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, just excellent.

This one is replacing my old Makita which worked great for years and probably still does, I just can't find it anywhere. Also kudos to Amazon for the fastest shipping ever. I ordered this kit at 7:30 PM Friday night. At 9:30 AM Saturday, the door bell rang and when I answered it, there was a brand new Makita sitting there. From the time I made the order to the time it arrived, 14 hours. I'm absolutely "STUNNED."
customer_reviews.author: Kamja

customer_reviews.title: Smoothest grinder, and best price.

This might be a good grinder, but the guards included with this kit clearly require a screwdriver. Because of the nature of what I do with this tool, constantly changing angles around the job site, the tool-less guard adjustment feature was very important to me... suffering buyer's remorse now.

customer_reviews.title: Great for Automotive DIY-er

The case is REALLY bulky, but I won't knock the review down a star just for that..

product_meta.title: Makita 9557PBX1 4-1/2" Paddle Switch Cut-Off/Angle Grinder
product_meta.description:
Style:Tool OnlyMakita’s 4-1/2” Cut-Off/Angle Grinder combines 7. 5 AMP power with comfort and motor-protection features for longer-lasting industrial performance. The 9557PB Angle Grinder delivers 11, 000 RPM, with soft start for smooth start-ups. The Cut-Off/Angle Grinder also features a range of durability features including labyrinth construction which seals and protects the motor and bearings from dust and debris for longer tool life, as well as a protective zig-zig varnish engineered to seal the armature from dust and debris. Ease-of-use features include an extra large paddle switch for comfortable operation, and a lock-on/off feature for continuous operation. The 9557PB weighs only 4. 5 lbs., with a side handle that can be easily installed on either side of the tool. In addition, the “tool-less” wheel guard adjustment provides easy clamping. This grinder also has an AC/DC switch for use with alternative-power sources. The 9557PB is a versatile and powerful grinder engineered for cutting, grinding and polishing applications. The 9557PBX1 is a kit that includes the Angle Grinder, 5 4-1/2” grinding wheels, metal tool case, cut-off and grinding wheel guards, as well as a Makita Diamond Blade with turbo rim engineering for constant contact with material for a smoother cut and finish.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
This powerful 7.5 Amp Makita angle grinder has an exclusive labyrinth construction that seals the motor and bearing from contamination.The 9557NBX features a switch (AC/DC) that is conveniently located on the top of the motor housing and a small circumference barrel grip for easy handling. 4-1/2" Angle Grinder AC/DC, 7.5A Motor For Heavy Professional Grinding Applications, Spindle Lock For Easy Wheel Changes, Small Circumference Barrel Grip For Easy Handling, Side Handle Can Be Installed On Either Side Of Tool For Operator Convenience, Switch Is Located On Side Of The Motor Housing; Lock-On Feature, Grinder Includes: 4-1/2" Grinding Wheels, Side Handle & Wheel Guard, Includes Extra Diamond Wheel and carry case.
